Class Automaton

java.lang.Object
Automaton
Direct Known Subclasses:
ElementaryAutomaton, TotalisticAutomaton
public abstract class Automaton extends Object
This class represents an ECA. Each Automaton encapsulates a Rule and an ArrayList of Generations. The ArrayList is ordered by time, with the first element being the initial Generation and the last being the current Generation.
Author:
Mounir Zahidi

  • Method Details

    • evolve

      public int evolve​(int numSteps)
      Evolve the Automaton a given number of steps, appending each successive Generation to the ArrayList.
      Parameters:
      numSteps - the number of times to evolve the Automaton
      Returns:
      the number of times the Automaton has been evolved

    • getGeneration

      public Generation getGeneration​(int stepNum)
      Return the Generation produced during the given time step.
      Parameters:
      stepNum - the stepNum of the generation to return.
      Returns:
      the generation at given step Number

    • getCurrentGeneration

      public Generation getCurrentGeneration()
      Return the current Generation
      Returns:
      the last generation available

    • getRuleNum

      public int getRuleNum()
      Returns:
      the Wolfram code for the rule that governs the ECA.

    • getTotalSteps

      public int getTotalSteps()
      Returns:
      the total number of times the Automaton has been evolved

    • saveEvolution

      public void saveEvolution​(String fileName) throws IOException
      Save the content of the Automaton into a file.
      Parameters:
      fileName - the file where we save the information about the Automaton
      Throws:
      IOException - when the file is not found

    • ruleTableString

      public String ruleTableString()
      Returns:
      A string representation of the table depicts the rule using the given characters to represent false and true.

    • createAutomaton

      public static Automaton createAutomaton​(CellularAutomaton ca, int ruleNum, Generation initial) throws RuleNumException
      Return an instance of the appropriate Automaton child given a CellularAutomaton value (ECA or TCA)
      Parameters:
      ca - the CellularAutomaton which decides whether ECA or TCA
      ruleNum - the rule number to use for evolving
      initial - the initial generation to start with
      Returns:
      an instance of the appropriate Automaton child
      Throws:
      RuleNumException - if the ruleNum is not a valid number
